values: 使面临，使遭遇；勇敢地面对，正视
When you confront someone, you meet them face to face to deal with a problem.
I confronted him as he left the meeting and told him I thought he was wrong.
v. to oppose or challenge especially in a direct and forceful way 与...对峙
